title: Bug 17618 - Failure to Remove Derived Resources When Changing Output Location
description: The issue concerns the failure to delete derived resources when changing the output location.
OB: When creating a project with autobuild enabled and importing Java sources and resources, changing the output folder to 'project/bin' correctly removes all class files. Similarly, changing the output folder back to the project also removes all class files. However, upon opening the 'project/bin' folder, all resources are still present, and properties dialog tags them as 'Derived'.
EB: The expected behavior is that when changing the output location, all derived resources created by the Java builder should be removed, ensuring a clean transition.
SR:
To reproduce the problem:
1) Create a project with autobuild enabled.
2) Import Java sources and resources.
3) Change the output folder to 'project/bin' (all class files are removed as expected).
4) Change the output folder back to the project (all class files are removed).
5) Open the 'project/bin' folder and observe that all resources remain, tagged as 'Derived' in the properties dialog.
